ある休日、日用品の買い物に出ていた時のことだ。\nドロテアから、スマートデバイス:
I was out shopping for daily necessities on a certain day off.
Dorothea contacted the smart device.
あの……お休みの日に、申し訳ありません。: Um... I'm sorry to bother you on your day off.
少々、ご相談がありまして……\n今ってお時間のほうはいかがでしょうか？:
I have something to discuss with you...
How's your time now?
空いてるけど……\nにしても、珍しいな……ドロテアから相談なんて。:
It's free, but...
Still, it's rare to get advice from Dorothea...
よかったら、直接会って話すか？: If you'd like, why don't we meet face-to-face?
えっ、いいんですか……？\nそんな拘束するつもりは……:
Huh? Are you sure...?
I don't intend to restrain you like that...
どうせ今日たいした用事もなかったし、気にしなくていいよ。\n１時間後にカフェでど:
I didn't have anything important to do today anyway, so don't worry about it.
Why don't we go to the café in an hour?
それでしたら……\nお願いしてもよろしいでしょうか？:
In that case...
May I ask you to do it?
じゃあ、カフェの場所だけど――: Well, as for the café's location—
それから俺とドロテアは、１時間後に指定したカフェで落ち合った。: Dorothea and I met up at the café we'd designated an hour later.
わざわざお時間を割いていただき、ありがとうございます。: Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule.
そんな改まらなくていいよ。\nむしろ頼ってくれて嬉しい。:
You don't have to change your mind.
In fact, I'm glad she's relying on me.
どうした？ そわそわして……どこか落ち着かない様子だけど……: What's wrong? You're fidgeting... You seem restless...
落ち着きなく見えますか……お恥ずかしい限りです。: Do I look unsettled...? How embarrassing.
カークランド家の者として、\nいつも堂々としていなくてはなりませんのに……:
As a member of the Kirkland family,
I always have to be bold...
その……実は少し緊張しておりまして……\nひとりでシティに来ることはあまりないの:
Umm... Actually, I'm a little nervous...
I don't come to the city alone very often...
そういえば今日はピクシス・マスールのメイド達――\nリュシー達は一緒じゃないのか:
Come to think of it, today were Pixis Masulu's maids—
Aren't Lucy and the others with you?
はい。でも一応リュシーにはあなたと待ち合わせていることを、\n書き置きで告げてい:
Yes. But I did tell Lucy that I was supposed to meet you...
I'm telling you in a note. However... I haven't told you the details.
もしかして、その相談ごとってリュシー達には話してないのか？: Don't tell me you haven't told Lucy and the others about that?
みんなの前で迷い、思い悩む頼りない姿を、\nあまり見せたくないので……:
She looked unreliable as she hesitated and agonized in front of everyone
I don't really want to show it to you...
ですが、ひとりで悩んでいても答えは出ず……\nそこでチーム以外で信頼できる方の意:
But I can't come up with an answer even if I worry about it alone...
So I thought I could ask for the opinion of someone I can trust outside of the team.
（それで俺を頼ってくれたのか……なんだか、光栄だな）: (So that's why he relied on me... It's kind of an honor.)
で、相談内容ってのはなんだ？: So, what did you want to talk about?
あなたもご存じの通り、\nわたくしは、カークランド家……貴族の家に産まれました。:
As you know,
I was born into the Kirkland family...a noble family.
そしていずれは、わたくしが家督を継ぐこととなります。\nそれ自体は良いのですが…:
And eventually, I will inherit the position of head of the family.
That in itself is fine, but...
恥ずかしながら今のわたくしには、\n家名を継ぐ者として――貴族として示すべき実績:
As embarrassing as it is to admit, right now,
As the heir to the family name—I have no achievements to demonstrate as a noble.
在学中になんとしても、家の名に恥じない\n実績を打ち立てないといけないのに……:
I'll do whatever it takes to live up to my family's name while I'm still in school.
I have to make a name for myself...
すでに所属校舎のユーロ・タワー屈指のパイロットじゃないか。\nそれって実績じゃな:
You're already one of the best pilots in Euro Tower, aren't you?
Isn't that a track record?
それだけでは足りません。数あるエピソードのひとつ……としては、\n悪くないのです:
That's not enough. It's one of the many episodes...
It's not bad, but...
なるほどな……それでどのようにその実績を作ればいいか、\n悩んでいるとか？:
I see... So that's how to make that track record, huh?
Are you worried about something?
そこで、あなたの意見を聞かせてほしいのです。: So I'd like to hear your opinion.
少し、街歩きでもしないか？: Why don't we walk around town for a bit?
正直俺もいきなり言われたところで、『じゃあ、これがいい』って案は\n浮かばない。:
Honestly, even if I were told that out of the blue, the idea of "then this is good" would be...
I can't think of anything.
ああ、だからお互い考えても何も浮かばないなら、\nいっそのこと『何も考えない』を:
Yeah, so if nothing comes to mind when we think about each other,
I figured it'd be better to just "think nothing" about it.
考えすぎると視野が狭くなったり、凝り固まったりするだろ？\n気分転換を挟んでそう:
If you think too hard about it, your field of vision gets narrower and stiffer, right?
It's a change of pace to reset that kind of thing.
なるほど……それで街歩き……: I see... So that's why we're walking around town...
確かにずっと思い詰めすぎて、少し袋小路に陥っていた気がします。\nそこからどう進:
It's true that I've been thinking too hard for a long time, and I feel like I'm in a bit of a dead end.
There's always the option of turning back rather than trying to figure out how to proceed from there.
そこから何か閃くものもありますでしょう。: I'm sure there's something that comes to mind from there.
そういうこった。じゃあ、さっそく店を出ようか。: Exactly. Let's get out of here, then.
実はあまり……日常の買い物はほとんどリュシー達に任せているので。: To tell you the truth... I've left most of my daily shopping to Lucy and the others.
こちらのお店のお洋服、とても素敵です！\n見てください、どれも可愛い……！:
The clothes in this shop are wonderful!
Look, they're all so cute...!
ふふっ、見ているだけで心が浮き立ちます。\nところであなたは――:
Hehe, just looking at it makes my heart float.
By the way, you're...
ああ、よく来るよ: Yeah, I come here a lot.
いや、あまり来ないかな: No, I don't think she'll come much.
こういうところによく来るんですか？: Do you come to places like this often?
そうなんですね。では今のわたくしは日々のあなたと、\n同じものを見ているんですね:
I see. In that case, as I am now,
So you're looking at the same thing...
では、わたくしと似ていますね。\n近い目線で物事を見れて嬉しいです。:
Well then, you are similar to me.
I'm glad to be able to see things from a close perspective.
ふふ、こういった服は普段着ることがないので、\nどうも『着た自分』というのが想像:
Hehe, I don't usually wear these kinds of clothes,
I can't imagine myself wearing it.
きっと似合うと思うよ。: I'm sure it'll look good on you.
そうでしょうか？ ふふ、殿方に言われると、\n少し照れてしまいますね。:
Is that so? Hehe, when the gentleman says that,
I'm a little embarrassed.
でもそういうのって、いわゆる社交界っていうのか？\nパーティーとかで言われ慣れて:
But is that what they call high society?
I thought you were used to being called that at parties and the like.
確かにパーティーで言われることは多いですが、\nそれとあなたからの言葉は全然別物:
It's true that a lot of people say that at parties, but...
What you're saying is completely different...
あ、いえ、なんでもありません！\nつ、次の場所へ向かいましょう！:
Oh, no, it's nothing!
Let's go to the next place!
お、おう？ ドロテアがそう言うなら、移動しようか。: H-Huh? If Dorothea says so, let's move.
ここは……とても賑やかですね……！\nこんなにも色々な種類の機械が……全部ゲーム:
This place... is so lively...!
So many different kinds of machines... Are they all game consoles?
そうだよ。もしかしてここに来るのは初めて？: That's right. Is this your first time here?
はい、リュシーからは教育に良くないと、\n止められておりまして……:
Yes, Lucy said it wasn't good for education.
It's been stopped...
もしかしてゲーム自体したことないとか？: Maybe you've never played a game before?
いえ、カードやチェスのようなボードゲームは嗜みますよ。\nただこういった機械仕掛:
No, I enjoy board games like cards and chess.
However, I've hardly ever touched anything mechanical like this.
じゃあ、試しに何かプレイしてみようか。: Well then, let's try playing something.
これはパンチングマシーンだな。\n筐体についたパッドを思いっきり殴って、その強さ:
This is a punching machine.
We're going to hit the pads on the cabinet as hard as we can and compete for their strength.
な、殴るんですか……？: A-Are you going to hit me...?
とりあえずやってみよう。\nスマートデバイスから支払って――っと。:
Anyway, let's give it a try.
I'll pay from the smart device.
意外といくな……さすがユーロ・タワー屈指のパイロット。: That's surprisingly impressive... I'd expect no less from one of the best pilots in Euro Tower.
この機種の表示では女性の平均が５０～７５キロ、\n男性の平均が１２０～１８０キロ:
On this model, the average for women is 50 to 75 kilometers.
The average man weighs between 120 and 180 kilograms, so his grades are pretty good.
ふふ、あなたもやってみませんか？\nどちらがより数値を出せるか、勝負してみたいで:
Heehee. Why don't you give it a try?
I'd like to see who can produce more numbers.
それなら……わかった。俺も挑戦してみるよ。: In that case... All right. I'll give it a try too.
（意外と負けず嫌いなのかもな、ドロテアって。\nこれは男として、負けられないな）:
(Maybe Dorothea hates losing more than I thought.
As a man, I can't lose.)
そんなことを思いながら、\nゲームをスタートさせ、全力でパンチを叩きこむ。:
As those thoughts ran through my head...
I started the game and punched with all my might.
す、すごい、２５０キロ！ 倍以上だなんて……！: W-Wow, 250 kilometers! That's twice as much...!
ははは、いいところ見せられてよかったよ。\n次のゲームに行くか？ あっちにはレー:
Hahaha, I'm glad I showed you my good side.
Want to go to the next game? There's racing and stuff over there.
その後、いくつかのゲームを軽く遊ぶうち、\n昼どきになったので食事にしようとゲー:
After that, we played a few games lightly.
Since it was lunchtime, I left the arcade to eat.
たくさんお店があって、目移りしますね。\nラーメンにハンバーガー、珍しいお食事が:
There are a lot of shops here, so I'm going to have to look around.
Ramen, hamburgers, lots of rare food!
こういうのはやっぱり……？: Is this really what it looks like...?
はい、普段の食事はリュシーが管理しているので、\nそもそも外食の機会というものが:
Yes, Lucy is in charge of the normal meals, so...
I don't get many chances to eat out in the first place...
そっか……なら、このあたりで何か――: I see... In that case, there's something around here――
『３０分以内に牛丼１０杯を食べられたなら無料』か。\n１０杯はさすがに厳しい――:
"If you get to eat ten beef bowls within thirty minutes, it's free," huh?
Ten bowls would be too much—
こういうの、以前から興味があったんです！\n挑戦とあらば、カークランド家の人間が:
I've always been interested in this sort of thing!
If it's a challenge, there's no way someone from the Kirkland family can run away!
お待たせしました！ 牛丼１杯目になります！\n１杯目が終わりましたら、２杯目を用:
Sorry to keep you waiting! This is the first bowl of gyudon!
After the first bowl is finished, I will prepare a second one, so please tell me!
ちなみに俺は普通の牛丼を注文した。\nドロテア、本気で１０杯食べるつもりだろうか:
Incidentally, I ordered a normal gyudon.
Dorothea, are you really going to eat ten bowls...?
これが、牛丼なんですね……なんて美味しそう！: So this is a gyuudon... It looks so delicious!
いけない、感動している場合ではありませんね。\n時間制限があるんでした！:
Oh no, this isn't the time to be moved.
There's a time limit!
ドロテアはスプーンを手に取ると、\nのんびりと紅茶とケーキでも嗜むかのような優雅:
Dorothea picked up her spoon
She began to eat with the grace of someone leisurely enjoying tea and cake—
うぅ、これほど厳しい結果になるとは、思いもよりませんでした。: Ugh, I didn't think it would turn out this harsh.
たったの３杯完食で終わってしまうだなんて……\n時間さえ、あればまだ頑張れました:
I can't believe it's all over after just three bowls...
If only I had time, I could still do my best.
（並盛とはいえ、女の子で３杯はすごいと思うけどな）: (She may be average, but I think three bowls for a girl would be amazing.)
（ただ、食べ方が上品というか、丁寧すぎたな……\n一口一口をあんな味わうように食:
(It's just that the way she ate it was refined, or rather, too polite...)
If I eat every bite like that, I probably won't make it in time...)
でも美味しかったですし、楽しかったです。\n腹ごなしに、少しお散歩いたしませんか:
But it was delicious, and it was fun.
Why don't we take a walk to eat?
それなら近くの公園へ行こう。: Then let's go to a nearby park.
ふう……今日はとても楽しかったです。\n見て、遊んで、食べて……どれもが新鮮でし:
Phew... Today was a lot of fun.
Watching, playing, eating... It was all so new.
それはよかった。でも肝心の実績の作り方については……\n俺は何もいいアイデアは出:
That's good to hear. But as for how to make a track record...
I didn't come up with any good ideas.
一応、あれこれ考えてはいたんだがな。\nドロテアはどうだ？:
I've been thinking about this and that for a while now.
What about Dorothea?
そうですね……端的にいえばわたくしも、\n気分転換を経たところで特に閃くアイデア:
You're right... To put it bluntly, I'm also...
After a change of pace, I didn't have any particular ideas.
ですが……こうして街で１日を過ごして、\n大切なことに気づけた気がします。:
But... now that I've spent a day in the city,
I feel like I've realized something important.
街で見かけた皆は、すごく平和そうに過ごしていました。\n仲間や友人達と何でもない:
Everyone I saw in the city seemed very peaceful.
While sharing a day of nothingness with friends and friends.
もちろん、個々に内心で抱えたものもあるでしょう。\nまさしく今のわたくしのように:
Of course, I'm sure there are some things you've carried on your mind individually.
Just like I am now...
ですが、その悩む自由すら存在するこの日常を、\n皆平和に、そして幸せそうに謳歌し:
However, this day-to-day life where even that freedom of worry exists...
Everyone was singing in peace and happiness.
きっとそれを守ることこそが、曲がりなりにも貴族として生まれた\n者の務めなんだと:
I'm sure protecting it is the very thing that gave birth to me as a noble.
I think it's the duty of a person.
ノブレス・オブリージュ、高貴なる者に伴う義務。\n貴族にとって大事なのは、実績と:
Noblesse oblige, the duty that comes with the Nobility.
What was important to nobles wasn't the "form" of achievements.
皆の平和で幸せな時間を守ろうとする『心』。\n本当に必要なのはそれだと……わたく:
A "heart" trying to protect everyone's peaceful, happy time.
That's what I really need... I thought.
こんな当然のことを、『貴族』であろうとして悩みすぎたがゆえに、\nいつの間にか頭:
Because I was worrying too much about such a natural thing as being a "noble"...
It seems to have slipped out of my head at some point.
ドロテアの生まれ故郷って確かノヴァセレスってところだっけ……\n君の言う『皆』っ:
Dorothea was born in Nova Celes, right?
By 'everyone' you mean the people there?
……もちろん、彼らも含みますが、彼らだけを守ればいいという\nものではありません:
...Of course, that includes them, but they say we just have to protect them.
It's not.
誰であろうが関係なく、『平和な日常を守る義務』を果たす意志こそが、\n真に恥じな:
It doesn't matter who it is, the will to fulfill the duty to protect the peaceful everyday life is the only thing that matters.
You truly are a noble to be ashamed of... That's what I think.
逆に言えばその意志さえあれば、仮に地位や名誉を失っても、\nきっとわたくし達は誇:
On the other hand, as long as you have that will, even if you lose your position and honor,
I'm sure we'll be able to be proud nobles.
そうか……ちなみにその平和な日常の中に、\nドロテア自身は含んでいるか？:
I see... By the way, in that peaceful everyday life...
Does Dorothea herself include it?
だってそうだろう？ 自分自身の平和な日常すら守れない人に、\n他人の日常なんて守:
I mean, isn't that right? To someone who can't even protect their own peaceful everyday life?
I don't think I can protect other people's daily lives.
だから、ちゃんと『平和な日常』の中に、\n自分自身も含んであげてほしいんだ。:
That's why I made sure to stay in my "peaceful daily life"...
I want you to include yourself in it.
はい……しっかり、わたくし自身の日常も守っていこうと思います。: Yes... I'll do my best to protect my daily life.
ああ、それでいい……って、ちょっと偉そうだったかな。: Yeah, that's fine... Wait, I guess I was acting a little self-important.
いえ、むしろあなたはわたくし達にとっても\n『教導指揮官』なんですから、もっと偉:
No, if anything, you're very important to us.
You're the 'Instructor's Commander', so you should be more proud of yourself.
ふふ、%usernameusernameuserna%さんらしいですね。\nそう:
Haha, that's very like you, %usernameusernameuserna%.
That part of her—
ふふ、これより先は秘密です。\n今はまだ胸の内にしまっておきましょう。:
Heehee. It's a secret from now on.
Let's keep it in our hearts for now.
なんだよ、それ。: What the hell is that supposed to mean?
こういうのは、ここぞというときに申し上げるから意味があるんですよ。\nなので、こ:
This kind of thing is meaningful because I say it when the time comes.
So let's talk about this another time.
……はは、わかった。\nそのときを楽しみにしているよ。:
...Haha, got it.
I look forward to that moment.
最後、何を言いたかったのかはわからないが、\nそうやって微笑む彼女の表情はとても:
I don't know what she was trying to say at the end, but...
As she smiled like that, her expression was very cheerful――
